metadata.Title: CVE-2018-13054 on Ubuntu 20.04 LTS (focal) - high
metadata.Description:
An issue was discovered in Cinnamon 1.9.2 through 3.8.6. Thecinnamon-settings-users.py GUI runs as root and allows configuration of(for example) other users' icon files in _on_face_browse_menuitem_activatedand _on_face_menuitem_activated. These icon files are written to therespective user's $HOME/.face location. If an unprivileged user prepares asymlink pointing to an arbitrary location, then this location will beoverwritten with the icon content.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-13054` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

cinnamon - 3.8.8-1
cinnamon-common - 3.8.8-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: cinnamon package in focal, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '3.8.8-1').
